metadata.name: KAARWAN
metadata.description:
Kaaarwan is a Persian word which means a "Group of Desert Travellers" 

This image was taken in Pushkar, Rajasthan, India during the annual Camel Fair. Every morning a camel herder would march towards the fair ground with his herd of camels. The spot I selected to shoot was risky because I was literally standing on the edge of open septic tank and camels would run at extreme speed on a muddy path located slightly above my head. Their speed made it difficult for me to create composition because the shooting window was just 2-3 minutes beyond which the sun will rise above the camels.
I could capture this on my 3rd attempt (3rd day early morning)
